pullRequest.body:
Let $R$ be a commutative ring and $(A_i)$ a bunch of $R$-algebras, then $\bigotimes_{R} A$ is an $R$-algebra as well. In particular, taking $R$ to be $\mathbb{Z}$, we get tensor product of rings

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

- [ ] depends on:#10986 (so that the doc string can refer to binary tensor product)

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/40106266-2d81-428c-b2a1-819c5f8cb480) for commit 499b5a2df313a319f140199b3c37e187e577fdd7.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/5410e290-061f-4e54-a7f7-95b4539a018d/to/40106266-2d81-428c-b2a1-819c5f8cb480) against commit bb76bc8ab25b80a67b7c98bc58c92df80343f8aa:
```diff
  Benchmark                                Metric         Change
  ==============================================================
- ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.PiTensorProduct   instructions    66.9%
```

There are still a couple of comments about the doc, but LGTM, thanks!

bors d+

:v: jjaassoonn can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I pushed quite a few changes to make this more consistent with `RingTheory.TensorProduct`; notably making some results work for towers of algebras. It would be nice to add something like:
```

#check hasSMul'

instance (priority := 100) isScalarTower_right [CommMonoid R'] [DistribMulAction R' R] [SMulCommClass R' R R]
    : IsScalarTower R' (⨂[R] i, A i) (⨂[R] i, A i) where
  smul_assoc r x y := by
    change r • x * y = r • (x * y)
    induction y using PiTensorProduct.induction_on with
    | @C1 yr yi => induction x using PiTensorProduct.induction_on with
      | @C1 xr xi =>
        simp only [mul_def, smul_comm (_ : R'), tprod_eq_tprodCoeff_one, smul_tprodCoeff' (_ : R')]
        rw [tprodCoeff_eq_smul_tprod, ←tprod_eq_tprodCoeff_one]
        simp_rw [map_smul, LinearMap.smul_apply, mul_tprod_tprod, smul_comm r]
        congr
        sorry
      | Cp hx hy => simp [smul_add, add_mul _, *]
    | Cp hx hy => simp [smul_add, mul_add _, *]
```
though I think there might be some more basic instances missing elsewhere.
If the CI passes, I will merge it @eric-wieser  @riccardobrasca

As this PR is labelled `auto-merge-after-CI`, we are now sending it to bors:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8125343083/job/22207845228)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8125343083/job/22207845082)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8125343083/job/22207845164)

Do you see a reason why the file [Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/PiTensorProduct.lean](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9395/files#diff-b7d0033f4a82efcf1df9b92c82d1a96dff948c4bcfbb6b04e90eb74f1b071c3c) is not in the folder `TensorProduct`?
I think this should go in `RingTheory.PiTensorProduct` to match `RingTheory.TensorProduct`.
If necessary, I will move this to another PR
maybe instead of editing, I should introduce a new function `reindex'` for a dependent version
I think you should split this to another PR, it looks orthogonal to the other results.
[#9445](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9445)

Can you relax these assumptions? For instance, you should be able to show that `⨂[R] i, A i` is a Ring when 
`∀ i, Ring (A i)`, or even a version for `AddCommGroupWithOne` like we do for the binary tensor product.
I have restructured this file, can you check if this is what you meant?
Can you add `CommSemiring` too?
(and perhaps even the non-associative/non-unital versions; they shouldn't be much more work, since they just package the same proofs in smaller pieces)

~~I don't think `lmul` works for non-associate/non-unital version because `lmul` really need `Algebra R (A i)` instances so that `x * update z i (r • a) = update (x * z) i (r•(x i * a)))` is true~~, I will use `SMulCommClass`
done

```suggestion
  __ := inferInstanceAs <| AddCommMonoidWithOne (⨂[R] i, A i)
```
I think this is `Pi.mulSingle`
thanks
Can you add a lemma that say this is equal to `tprod _ (Pi.mulSingle i (algebraMap _ _ r))`?
done
I think there's some missing infrastructure here; can you first define `PiTensorProduct.map` to match `TensorProduct.map`? Then I think you might be able to take some ideas from #6195.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (⨂[R] i, s i) →ₗ[R] ⨂[R] i, t i := ```

I think this should have type
```suggestion
def map (f : ∀ i, s i →ₗ[R] t i) : (⨂[R] i, s i) →ₗ[R] ⨂[R] i, t i where
```
to match `TensorProduct.map`. What you have here is `TensorProduct.homTensorHomMap`, so should probably be called `PiTensorProduct.piTensorHomMap` to match.
done
This PR is getting too big, should we split `map`

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion MultilinearMap R (fun i ↦ s i →ₗ[R] t i) (MultilinearMap R s (⨂[R] (i : ι), t i)) := ```

```suggestion

This is the n-ary version of `TensorProduct.map`
-/
```
Can you do something analogous for all of these?

```suggestion
{ toFun := (tprod R).compLinearMap
```
Perhaps this indicates that this should be expressed in the generality of "`compLinearMap` is itself a multilinear map"?
There is `MultilinearMap.compLinearMapMultilinear`, but I am not sure this is what we want here
It's `(LinearMap.applyₗ (tprod R)).compMultilinearMap compLinearMapMultilinear`
Thanks!

Could use
```suggestion
  lift <| (tprod R).compLinearMap f
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion MultilinearMap R (fun i ↦ M₁ i →ₗ[R] M₁' i) (MultilinearMap R M₁ M₂) := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion MultilinearMap R (fun i ↦ M₁ i →ₗ[R] M₁' i) (MultilinearMap R M₁ M₂) := ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion MultilinearMap R M₁' M₂ →ₗ[R] ```

```suggestion
/--
Let `M₁ᵢ` and `M₁ᵢ'` be two families of `R`-modules and `M₂` an `R`-module. Let us denote `Π i, M₁ᵢ` and `Π i, M₁ᵢ'` by `M` and
`M'` respectively.
If `g` is a multilinear map `M' → M₂`, then `g` can be reinterpreted as a multilinear
map of multilinear map from `Π i, M₁ᵢ ⟶ M₁ᵢ'` to `M ⟶ M₂` by `(fᵢ) ↦ v ↦ g(fᵢ vᵢ)`.
-/
```

```suggestion
Let `sᵢ` and `tᵢ` be families of `R`-modules and let `fᵢ` be a family of `R`-linear maps `sᵢ → tᵢ`, then
there is an induced map `F : ⨂ᵢ sᵢ → ⨂ᵢ tᵢ` by `⨂ aᵢ ↦ ⨂ fᵢ aᵢ`.

This is `TensorProduct.map` for an arbitrary family of modules.
```
The docstring seems a little inaccurate, there is no `fᵢ` in the statement.

```suggestion
Let `sᵢ` and `tᵢ` be families of `R`-modules and let `fᵢ` be a family of `R`-linear maps `sᵢ → tᵢ`, then
`⨂ᵢ fᵢ` induces an `R`-linear map `F` between `⨂ᵢ sᵢ` and `⨂ᵢ tᵢ` by
`F(⨂ aᵢ) = ⨂ f(aᵢ)`.
```
Can you add an explanation about the relation with `map` defined just above?
Please use `Π` instead of `∀` for data.
The name should be something like `map_apply`. Similarly for the lemmas below  (maybe `simps` can generate it).

I changed them to `map_apply_tprod`, but this is inconsistent with `TensorProduct`, for example `TensorProduct.map_tmul`.

Thanks for the suggestion, but `@[simps]` will generate a wrong lemma in this case (it  just unfolds the definition)
Hmm, I see, it's not exactly an `apply` lemma. Being consistent is probably more important, sorry for the useless comment.
No worries, I have reverted this change
I don't understand this line.
I think you would like the new version better )

Again there is no `fᵢ` in the statement.

Also, why using `tᵢ` twice? `TensorProduct.map` was generalized above, so I don't understand exactly what you are doing here.
One is `t`, the other is `t prime`, `map` takes care of the case `s -> t`, `map2` takes care of `s -> t -> t prime`
Ah sorry, I didn't notice the `'`.
Same as above, you should clarify better what you are doing.
Can you use `induction` rather than `induction` (the latter sooner or later will disappear). Similarly below.

```suggestion
The map `Aᵢ ⟶ ⨂ᵢ Aᵢ` given by `a ↦ 1 ⊗ ... ⊗ a ⊗ 1 ⊗ ...`, where `a` is at the `i`-th place.
```

```suggestion
/--
Let `M₁ᵢ` and `M₁ᵢ'` be two families of `R`-modules and `M₂` an `R`-module.
Let us denote `Π i, M₁ᵢ` and `Π i, M₁ᵢ'` by `M` and `M'` respectively.
If `g` is a multilinear map `M' → M₂`, then `g` can be reinterpreted as a multilinear
map from `Π i, M₁ᵢ ⟶ M₁ᵢ'` to `M ⟶ M₂` via `(fᵢ) ↦ v ↦ g(fᵢ vᵢ)`.
-/
```

```suggestion
Then there is an `R`-linear map between `⨂ᵢ Hom(sᵢ, tᵢ)` and `Hom(⨂ᵢ sᵢ, ⨂ tᵢ)` defined by
```
Can you add this result? It seems `simp` doesn't prove it (but `ext; simp` does it).
done

```suggestion
Let `sᵢ`, `tᵢ` and `t'ᵢ` be families of `R`-modules, then `f : Πᵢ sᵢ → tᵢ → t'ᵢ` induces an
```

```suggestion
If `(Aᵢ)` is a family of `R`-algebras then the `R`-tensor product `⨂ᵢ Aᵢ` is an `R`-algebra as well with structure map defined by `r ↦ r • 1`.

In particular if we take `R` to be `ℤ`, then this collapses into the tensor product of rings.
```
@eric-wieser is using `__` OK here? I mean, should we worry about how these instances are defined or now everything should just work?
Everything should just work I think. Certainly `__` is no worse than `with`

It's a bit weird to me to add these for the n-ary tensor product, but not the binary one. Ideally we'd add it there (in a separate PR) and reference it in the docstring, but perhaps until then:
```suggestion
This is `PiTensorProduct.map` for two arbitrary families of modules.
Note that for now, there is no `TensorProduct` analogue of this construction.
-/
def map₂ (f : Π i, s i →ₗ[R] t i →ₗ[R] t' i) :
    (⨂[R] i, s i) →ₗ[R] (⨂[R] i, t i) →ₗ[R] ⨂[R] i, t' i:=
  lift <| LinearMap.compMultilinearMap piTensorHomMap <| (tprod R).compLinearMap f
```
and similarly everywhere else that you've built API that doesn't exist for `TensorProduct`
Do you plan to do this in another PR?
Yes, I will do this in another PR
#10986 here it is

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion dsimp [← mul_def] ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [this, ← smul_one_smul R r (1 : A i), MultilinearMap.map_smul, update_eq_self, smul_one_smul] ```
These `C1` and `Cp` names are pretty lousy, so I created #10904
fixed

```suggestion
def tprodSingleAlgHom [DecidableEq ι] (i : ι) : A i →ₐ[R] ⨂[R] i, A i where
```
or perhaps just
```suggestion
def singleAlgHom [DecidableEq ι] (i : ι) : A i →ₐ[R] ⨂[R] i, A i where
```
since the `inl` and `inr` versions for `TensorProduct` are quite succinctly named
I would guess that `AlgHom.ofLinearMap` makes this shorter.
`rw [LinearMap.map_mul_iff]; ext` might shorten this proof
Sorry for the late reply. Indeed works like a charm. Thanks!

```suggestion
This is `TensorProduct.map₂` for families of modules.
```
The first sentence contradicts the second!
Ah forgot to delete the second sentence. Thanks
